Metadata: Stormwater runoff into Santa Monica Bay: sources and impacts
"California and the World Ocean '97," San Diego California, March 24-27, 1997.

This is a collection of five papers studying stormwater runoff into Santa Monica Bay in California. Topics include: adverse health effects of swimming, strategy for managing urban runoff pollution, surface water monitoring, stormwater identification/​disperson, and effects of runoff.

The following papers are included in this document: 1. Suface water monitoring under the country's largest municipal stormwater permit. Bill DePoto, et al. pp. 857- 868. 2. An epidemiological study of possible adverse health effects of swimming in Santa Monica Bay. Guang-yu Wang pp. 869-875. 3. An integrated strategy of managing urban runoff pollution in Los Angeles County. Xavier Swamikannu pp. 876- 887. 4. Stormwater runoff into Santa Monica Bay: identification, impact and dispersion. Burton H. Jones and Libe Washburn pp. 888-899. 5. Stormwater runoff effects on Santa Monica Bay: toxicity, sediment quality, and benthic community impacts. Steven Bay, et al. pp. 900-921.
